intro: Neonauclea paracyrtopoda, commonly known as the African moonseed, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Rubiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its small, showy flowers that are typically white or pink. The plant has simple, opposite leaves and produces small, fleshy fruits that contain several seeds. It is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and shrublands. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in horticultural settings.
